entries.title: Many updates and deployment of the changelog app
entries.whats_new: The changelog web app has been completed with automatic summarization, deployed API and front-end, bug fixes, and improvements to cache strategies.
entries.breaking_change: The app now automatically summarizes changelog entries and generates detailed reports, which may alter previous manual reports. Users can now configure their own repositories, models, and API keys, enhancing customization capabilities.
entries.impact: Users will experience an automated, more detailed, and customizable changelog generation process, simplifying project tracking and management.

entries.title: Interface management and front-end polishing
entries.whats_new: Interfaces were consolidated into a single file for easier management, and the front-end homepage, loading effects, and detail pages were enhanced with new features and styles.
entries.breaking_change: The changelog detail page now directs users to specific entry details when clicked, improving navigation.
entries.impact: Users will find the interface clearer and navigation more intuitive, with improved visual effects and detailed entry views.

entries.title: Backend connection and layout updates
entries.whats_new: The backend now generates a cache in JSON format for the front-end to load, and the page layout was centered with a new icon. Sidebar navigation was also polished.
entries.breaking_change: The backend now produces a JSON cache before loading, changing the data retrieval process and layout content from previous versions.
entries.impact: Changelog data loads faster via cache, and the interface layout is more organized, providing a smoother user experience.

entries.title: Initial front-end development with basic layout
entries.whats_new: The front-end was built with a sidebar for navigation, overview pages, and placeholders for changelog content. The initial interface supports browsing changelog data.
entries.breaking_change: A new web interface allows users to view changelogs automatically generated by OpenAI, replacing manual processes.
entries.impact: Users get a visual web experience to view automatically summarized changelogs, enhancing clarity and accessibility.

entries.title: Backend API and OpenAI support
entries.whats_new: Back-end API was implemented supporting commit data, with support for caching and improved API features, including auto-detection of breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: The data generator now automatically detects breaking changes within commit messages, changing how changelogs are summarized.
entries.impact: The changelog reports are now more precise, highlighting critical breaking changes for users to act upon promptly.
